name: Led Zeppelin Lyrics Multiple Choice Quiz | Led Zeppelin | 10 Questions

questions.text: `We come from the land of the ice and snow, from the midnight sun where the hot springs blow`
questions.explanation:
Immigrant Song.

	Inspired by a visit to Iceland by Robert Plant in June, 1970.

questions.text: `Walking side by side with death, the devil mocks their every step; the snow drives back the foot that`s slow, the dogs of doom are howling more`
questions.explanation:
No Quarter.

	This was John Paul Jones` trademark song during live concerts.

questions.text: `To seek the man with pointing hand, the giant steps unfold, with guidance from the curving path, that churns up into stone`
questions.explanation:
Achilles Last Stand.

	Inspired by the group's visit to North Africa, apparently!

questions.text: `Well you know they asked us to stay for tea and have some fun; oh,oh,oh, he said that his friends would all drop by`
questions.explanation:
Misty Mountain Hop.

	Inspired by a hippy love-in fest that was broken up by the police, according to Robert Plant.

questions.text: `Vixen in my dreams, with great surprise to me, never thought I`d see your face the way it used to be`
questions.explanation:
Ten Years Gone.

	Inspired by an ultimatum given to Plant ten years earlier by a former girlfriend: to give up music and settle down with her.

questions.text: `T`was in the darkest depths of Mordor, I met a girl so fair; but Gollum and the evil one crept up and slipped away with her`
options: What Is And Should Never Be
questions.explanation:
Ramble On.

	Inspired by Tolkein`s `Lord of the Rings`, long before the movie versions!

questions.text: `Lyin`, cheatin`, hurtin`, that`s all you seem to do; messin` around with every guy in town`
questions.explanation:
Your Time Is Gonna Come.

	John Paul Jones played a church organ on this song from the first Led Zeppelin album.

questions.text: `How keen the storied hunter`s eye prevails upon the land; to seek the unsuspecting and the weak`
options: Over The Hills And Far Away
questions.explanation:
Carouselambra.

	From the `In Through the Out Door` album, the lyrics are deliberately oblique, according to Robert Plant, but are aimed at a specific person who will one day discover their meaning!

questions.text: `All I see turns to brown, as the sun burns the ground; and my eyes fill with sand, as I scan this wasted land`
questions.explanation:
Kashmir.

	Composed by Robert Plant during a holiday in Morocco, which of course is nowhere near Kashmir!

questions.text: `Your head is humming and it won`t go, in case you don`t know; The piper`s calling you to join him`
questions.explanation:
Stairway To Heaven.

	Well, I couldn`t do a Zeppelin lyrics quiz without including their most famous song!
